cnd18:0.1: 18. Recitation About the Way to the Far Shore
cnd18:1.1: (Chapter title abbreviated; the full title is _Explanation of the Verses Recited
cnd18:1.2: About the Way to the Far Shore_.)
cnd18:2.2: I will recite the other side road, as he sees it, as he tells it:
cnd18:2.3: The unflawed man, the vast wise one,
cnd18:2.7: I will recite the other side road, as he sees it, as he tells it:
cnd18:2.8: The unflawed man, the vast wise one,
cnd18:2.12: I will recite the other side road, as he sees it, as he tells it:
cnd18:2.13: The unflawed man, the vast wise one,
cnd18:2.17: I will recite the other side road, as he sees it, as he tells it:
cnd18:2.18: The unflawed man, the vast wise one,
cnd18:2.22: I will recite the other side road, as he sees it, as he tells it:
cnd18:2.23: The unflawed man, the vast wise one,
cnd18:3.1: "I'm going to recite the other side road": I'm going to recite what's been
cnd18:3.2: recited, I'm going to recite what's been told along with the narration, I'm
cnd18:3.3: going to talk about what's been talked about, I am going to say what has been
cnd18:4.1: "[Like this Venerable Piṅgiya]": "Like this," the continuation of the sentences,
cnd18:4.2: the connection of the words, the completion of the sentences, the combination of
cnd18:4.3: words, this is the order of the sentence, which is "like this." "Venerable,"
cnd18:4.4: this is a synonym of love, respect, and obedience. "Piṅgiya," the name, title,
cnd18:4.5: security of the Brāhmaṇa, title, word, phrase.
cnd18:5.1: "If he sees like this, he speaks": If he sees like this, he tells, explains,
cnd18:5.2: teaches, informs, establishes, uncovers, analyzes, and clarifies: "All actions
cnd18:5.3: are impermanent," as he sees like this..., "all actions are suffering"..., "all
cnd18:5.4: dhammas are selfless"..., "every collection of dhammas is extinction of
cnd18:6.1: "The unflawed man, the vastly wise one": The unflawed; greed is a flaw, hatred
cnd18:6.2: is a flaw, ignorance..., anger, resentment, all unwholesome deeds; and flaws,
cnd18:6.3: for the Buddha and the Blessed One, have been cut off, and the roots have been
cnd18:6.4: cut off, just like a palm tree without roots, becoming non-existent, something
cnd18:6.5: non-living for the future. The Buddha is the defouler, the descaler, the one who
cnd18:6.6: has abandoned the flaws, the one who has been freed from the flaws, the one who
cnd18:6.7: has overcome all the flaws. Vastly wise; as the earth is called wide As the
cnd18:6.8: earth is called wide, the Blessed One has the same vast and expanding wisdom as
cnd18:7.1: "Desire-free, desireless untangled nāga (noble one, or elephant)": "Desire,"
cnd18:7.2: There are two types of desires: the desire for things and the desire for
cnd18:7.3: pollution. What are the desires for things? Desirable sight, sound, smell,
cnd18:7.4: taste, touch; bedding, clothing, maidservants, goats and sheep, chickens and
cnd18:7.5: pigs, elephants, cows, horses, mules, horses, fields, houses, gold, gold coins,
cnd18:7.6: villages and towns, capitals, countries, territories, treasuries, warehouses;
cnd18:7.7: everything that can be tainted by greed is the desire for things.
cnd18:8.1: In addition, there are past desires, future desires, present desires, internal
cnd18:8.2: desires, external desires, internal and external desires, inferior desires,
cnd18:8.3: medium desires, superior desires; desires in the suffering world, human desires,
cnd18:8.4: heavenly desires, existing desire, created desire, uncreated desire, created
cnd18:8.5: desire by others, possessed desire, unpossessed desire, cherished desire,
cnd18:8.6: non-cherished desires; the desires of all the worlds of desire, the desires of
cnd18:8.7: all the worlds of physicality, all the desires of the world of non-material
cnd18:8.8: worlds, dependence on thirst and desire for love, desiring righteousness, greed
cnd18:8.9: for righteousness, the desire to be intoxicated by righteousness and happiness,
cnd18:8.10: is called the desire for things.
cnd18:9.1: What is the desire for defilement? The desire for desire, the desire for greed,
cnd18:9.2: the desire of desire to greed, the desire of intention, the desire for lust, the
cnd18:9.3: desire for intention, the joy of desire, love obsession, the binding harness of
cnd18:9.4: desire, attachment, the desire for cover.
cnd18:10.2: Wanting to be produced by thought (intention),
cnd18:10.3: I will not think of them,
cnd18:11.1: These are called polluting desires. Craving thirst, attachment, it is greed,
cnd18:11.2: lust, acquiescence, conformity, joy, desire, obsession, taking, contaminated,
cnd18:11.3: disturbance, fraud, (reincarnation) root cause, (bitter) fertility, tailoring
cnd18:11.4: (greed), net, river, bondage, rope, attachment, accumulation, companionship,
cnd18:11.5: desire, intimate interaction, forest, jungle, love, expectation, relationship,
cnd18:11.6: desire for form, desire for sounds, desire for smells, desire for tastes, desire
cnd18:11.7: for touches, desire for acquisition, desire for wealth, desire for sons, desire
cnd18:11.8: for life, the state of desire, hope, prayer, greedy appearance, possessing
cnd18:11.9: greed, inquiring for profit, illegal greed, improper greed, hope, envy, desire
cnd18:11.10: for desire, desire for nothingness, desire for form, formless thirst,
cnd18:11.11: extinguished thirst, form thirst, sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst,
cnd18:11.12: touch thirst, dhamma thirst, torrent, harness, binding, clinging, obstacles,
cnd18:11.13: covering, defilements, potential trends of troubles, entanglement, vines,
cnd18:11.14: stinginess, suffering roots, causes of suffering, occurrence of suffering,
cnd18:11.15: magical nets, magical hooks, magical food, the realm of the devil, the residence
cnd18:11.16: of the devil, the state of the devil, the bondage of the devil, the river of
cnd18:11.17: thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of thirst, the sea of thirst, craving,
cnd18:11.18: greed, and the root of unwholesomeness.
cnd18:12.1: The Blessed One does not desire in desire; does not pray in desire; does not
cnd18:12.2: want in desire; does not ask in desire). Whoever desires in desire; prays in
cnd18:12.3: desire; hopes in desire; asks in desire, they are those who have desires for
cnd18:12.4: desires, those who have greed for greed, and those who have thoughts about
cnd18:12.5: desires. The Blessed One does not desire desires; does not want desires; does
cnd18:12.6: not hope for desires; does not ask desires. Therefore, the Buddha, those who
cnd18:12.7: have no desire, those who have renounced their desires, those who have abandoned
cnd18:12.8: their desires, those who have eliminated their desires, those who have liberated
cnd18:12.9: their desires, those who have forsaken their desires, those who have cut off
cnd18:12.10: their desires, those who have renounced greed, those who have no greed, those
cnd18:12.11: who have renounced greed, those who have eliminated greed, those who have been
cnd18:12.12: liberated from greed, those who have cut off greed, those who have forsaken
cnd18:12.13: greed, those who are not hungry, those who have extinguished, those who have
cnd18:12.14: become cool, those who feel happy, and those who live as Brāhmaṇas.
cnd18:13.1: "For those who have no entangled desire," greed is entangled desire; hatred...
cnd18:13.2: It is said that it has been cut off, and the root has been cut off....
cnd18:13.3: Therefore, the Buddha is a person who has no entangled desire.... The one who
cnd18:13.4: has no desire. "Nāga (noble one)," the Blessed One does not commit crimes as a
cnd18:13.5: "noble one;" does not go as a "noble one;" does not come as a "noble one." How
cnd18:13.6: is "the Blessed One does not commit a crime" a noble one? Crime is called evil
cnd18:13.7: unwholesome dhamma: following pollution, re-existing, fearful, bitter, future
cnd18:14.2: "He who does not commit any crime in the world,
cnd18:14.3: After leaving all bonds and ties,
cnd18:14.4: Does not cling to everything and is freed.
cnd18:14.5: Those like this are truly called noble ones."
cnd18:15.1: How is "The Blessed One is not going" as a noble one? The Blessed One does not
cnd18:15.2: go because of not wanting; not because of terror; not because of greed; not
cnd18:15.3: because of hatred; not because of ignorance; not because of conceit; not because
cnd18:15.4: of views; not because of disbelief; not because of doubt; not because of
cnd18:15.5: potential troubles; not be carried away by quarrels (disharmony), walk, led, be
cnd18:16.1: How is "The Blessed One is not coming" as a noble one? Any pollution that is cut
cnd18:16.2: off by the Sotāpanna Path, the pollution he no longer experiences, does not
cnd18:16.3: return, and does not go back; by the Sakadāgāmī Path...; by the Anāgāmī Path...;
cnd18:17.1: "For what reason will he say falsely": "For what reason," For what reason? What
cnd18:17.2: is the cause? What is the condition? "Speaking falsely" means speaking, telling,
cnd18:17.3: explaining, saying falsely, to speak falsehood, to speak non-sacred words: here,
cnd18:17.4: a certain type of people go to the synagogue or to the assembly, or to the
cnd18:17.5: relatives, or to the group, or to the palace, brought as a witness to question:
cnd18:17.6: "Come, man! Please tell me what you know of the way." He says without knowing:
cnd18:17.7: "I know." Or, if he knows it, he says: "I don't know." He doesn't see it and
cnd18:17.8: says, "I see." Or, when he sees it, he says, "I didn't see it." Like this, he
cnd18:17.9: deliberately speaks vainly based on his own cause, or the cause of others, or
cnd18:18.1: Or, taking three behaviors as "liars": just before (saying) (thinking): "I will
cnd18:18.2: say lies." When said, (thinking): "I'm speaking lies." When I have said it,
cnd18:18.3: (thinking): "I have said the lies." Take these three behaviors as lies. Or,
cnd18:18.4: taking four behaviors: just before (saying), (thinking): "I will say a lie."
cnd18:18.5: When said, (thinking): "I'm speaking lies." When it has been said (thinking): "I
cnd18:18.6: have said the lies." There are opinions of different attachments (errors), and
cnd18:18.7: these four behaviors are regarded as lie. Or, take five forms..., six forms...,
cnd18:18.8: seven forms..., eight forms as lies: Before saying.... There are (wrong)
cnd18:18.9: opinions of different attachments, the likes of different attachments, the
cnd18:18.10: inclinations of different attachments, the desires of different attachments, and
cnd18:18.11: the nature of different attachments. These eight behaviors are regarded as lies
cnd18:19.1: <em>103 : Belonging to those who have given up their ignorance and foulness,
cnd18:19.2: To those who have given up on conceit and hiding of evil,
cnd18:19.3: Come! I will tell of the beautiful words.
cnd18:19.4: <em>103 : Belonging to those who have given up their ignorance and foulness,
cnd18:19.5: To those who have given up on conceit and hiding of evil,
cnd18:19.6: Come! I will tell of the beautiful words.
cnd18:19.7: <em>103 : Belonging to those who have given up their ignorance and foulness,
cnd18:19.8: To those who have given up on conceit and hiding of evil,
cnd18:19.9: Come! I will tell of the beautiful words.
cnd18:20.1: "Belonging to those who have given up on ignorance and foulness": "Foulness,"
cnd18:20.2: greed..., anger.., ignorance..., sloth..., seeing..., pollution..., all evil
cnd18:20.3: deeds are foulness; the kamma is dirt.
cnd18:21.1: "Ignorance," the ignorance of suffering.... For the Buddha and the Blessed One,
cnd18:21.2: ignorance and foulness have been cut off.... Therefore, the Buddha is the one
cnd18:21.3: who has renounced ignorance and foulness.
cnd18:22.1: "To those who renounce conceit and hide evil": "Conceit," one type of conceit:
cnd18:22.2: that is the height of the heart; two types...: self praise is conceited,
cnd18:22.3: contempt for others is conceited; three: "I am the winner"..., "I am the same,"
cnd18:22.4: "I am the inferior;" four: to gain, to have fame, praise, and comfort; five: "I
cnd18:22.5: obtain the desired form," "I obtain the desired sound," smell..., taste...,
cnd18:22.6: touch....; six types: with eyes..., ears..., nose, tongue, body, ...satisfaction
cnd18:22.7: of the mind makes one conceited; seven: conceit, arrogance, conceit and
cnd18:22.8: arrogance, humbleness, conceit of increase, conceit of self-reality, conceit of
cnd18:22.9: evil; eight: obtaining makes one conceited, not obtaining..., fame, no fame,
cnd18:22.10: praise, rebuke, happiness, and suffering; nine: the winner thinks: "I am the
cnd18:22.11: winner"..., the winner thinks: "I am the same," the winner thinks: "I am the
cnd18:22.12: inferior"...; and equal think: "I am the winner," the equal thinks: "I am the
cnd18:22.13: same," the equal thinks: "I am the inferior," the inferior thinks: "I am the
cnd18:22.14: winner," the inferior thinks: "I am the same," the inferior thinks: "I am the
cnd18:22.15: inferior;" ten types...: here, by certain birth, or surname, or good family, or
cnd18:22.16: beauty like a lotus, or property, or research (acquisition), or career, or
cnd18:22.17: craftsmanship, or study, or by what you hear, or by arguing, or by something to
cnd18:22.18: make one conceited; anyone who, like this, with this type of heart conceit,
cnd18:22.19: thinking, perceiving the situation, high tribute, high conceit, as a banner, as
cnd18:22.20: a flag, heart vanity is called conceited.
cnd18:23.1: "Hiding evil," the act of hiding evil, hypocrisy, envy, jealous behavior, this
cnd18:23.2: is called hiding evil. For the Buddha and the Blessed One, the conceit and the
cnd18:23.3: hiding of evil have been cut off.... Therefore, the Buddha is a person who
cnd18:23.4: abandons conceit and hiding of evil.
cnd18:24.1: "Come! I will tell of the beautiful words": "Come," the continuation of
cnd18:24.2: sentences; the connection of sentences; the completion of sentences; the
cnd18:24.3: combination of words; the connection of words and sentences; this is the order
cnd18:24.4: of the sentence, which is "come." "I will speak of the beautiful words," reach
cnd18:24.5: (have), arrive, enter, fully enter, have enough, sufficiently, have beautiful
cnd18:24.6: words, language, and speech, I will tell, teach, build, uncover, parse, and
cnd18:25.1: <em>104 : Dispelling the dark, enlightened, and all-seeing,
cnd18:25.2: Who has reached the edge of the world, surpassing all (existences),
cnd18:25.3: Who has no troubles, gives up all suffering, who is truly called (a Sambuddha),
cnd18:25.4: Brāhmaṇa! He is served by me.
cnd18:25.5: <em>104 : Dispelling the dark, enlightened, and all-seeing,
cnd18:25.6: Who has reached the edge of the world, surpassing all (existences),
cnd18:25.7: Who has no troubles, gives up all suffering, who is truly called (a Sambuddha),
cnd18:25.8: Brāhmaṇa! He is served by me.
cnd18:25.9: <em>104 : Dispelling the dark, enlightened, and all-seeing,
cnd18:25.10: Who has reached the edge of the world, surpassing all (existences),
cnd18:25.11: Who has no troubles, gives up all suffering, who is truly called (a Sambuddha),
cnd18:25.12: Brāhmaṇa! He is served by me.
cnd18:25.13: <em>104 : Dispelling the dark, enlightened, and all-seeing,
cnd18:25.14: Who has reached the edge of the world, surpassing all (existences),
cnd18:25.15: Who has no troubles, gives up all suffering, who is truly called (a Sambuddha),
cnd18:25.16: Brāhmaṇa! He is served by me.
cnd18:26.1: "Dispelling the dark, enlightened, and all-seeing": "Dispelling the dark," the
cnd18:26.2: darkness of greed, the darkness of aversion, ...ignorance, ...sloth, seeing...,
cnd18:26.3: pollution..., ...evil, blindness, lack of wisdom, destruction of wisdom, vexing
cnd18:26.4: factions, that which does not lead to Nibbāna; to exclude, remove, abandon,
cnd18:26.5: drive away, end, and make it go to non-existence. "That is the Blessed One...."
cnd18:26.6: All eyes are called the state of all-knowing wisdom. Therefore, the Blessed One
cnd18:26.7: reaches (has), enters, enters completely, has sufficiently, the state of wisdom.
cnd18:27.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd18:27.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd18:27.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd18:27.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."
cnd18:28.1: "Those who have reached the edge of the world, surpassing all others": "World,"
cnd18:28.2: one world: the world of existence; two worlds: the world of existence and the
cnd18:28.3: arising world; what has become into the world and what arises becomes the world;
cnd18:28.4: there is the world of degeneration and the degeneration of the arising of the
cnd18:28.5: world. Three worlds: three feelings. Four worlds: four nutriments. Five worlds:
cnd18:28.6: five accumulations. Six worlds: six inner worlds. Seven worlds: seven
cnd18:28.7: consciousness dwellings. Eight worlds: eight world systems. Nine worlds: where
cnd18:28.8: the nine living beings live. Ten worlds: ten places. Twelve worlds: twelve
cnd18:28.9: places. Eighteen worlds: eighteen worlds. "Those who have reached the edge of
cnd18:28.10: the world," The Blessed One is the one who has reached the edge of the world;
cnd18:28.11: has reached the end; ...reached the Nibbāna; arrived at the Nibbāna,
cnd18:28.12: ...descended into the state, ...practiced ...the cycle of life and death,
cnd18:29.1: "Beyond all," there are two types of "beyond all": in kamma and rebirth. What is
cnd18:29.2: kamma? Blessed deeds, non-blessed deeds, and immovable deeds are kamma. What is
cnd18:29.3: rebirth? The forms, feelings, thoughts, behaviors and consciousness of the knot
cnd18:29.4: are rebirth. The Blessed One is the transcended one, the one who has passed
cnd18:29.5: through, and the one who has overcome.
cnd18:30.1: "Those who have no worries (troubles), those who give up all suffering": There
cnd18:30.2: are four types of worries in "worries": worries of desire, worries of being,
cnd18:30.3: worries of seeing, worries of ignorance. Those worries have been given up, as
cnd18:30.4: the Buddha and the Blessed One, cut off, ..., so the Buddha is a trouble-free
cnd18:30.5: person. "To cut off all suffering," to him, everything belonging to the
cnd18:30.6: reproduction of life, suffering, old age suffering, sickness, death, sorrow,
cnd18:30.7: grief, despair..., the suffering of decay has been cut off, cooled, calmed down,
cnd18:30.8: stopped, unable to arise, and burned by the fire of wisdom. The Buddha is the
cnd18:30.9: one who gives up all suffering.
cnd18:31.1: "Truly called, Brāhmaṇa! Be served by me": "Truly called," Truly addressed,
cnd18:31.2: equivalent name, equivalent addresser, true equivalent addressee; Vipassī
cnd18:31.3: Buddha, Sikhī Buddha, Vessabhū, Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, Kassapa — those Buddhas,
cnd18:31.4: and the Blessed One (Gotama), are those who have the same name and the same
cnd18:31.5: (mode of) address, and Sakyamuni also belongs to those Buddhas, and the Blessed
cnd18:31.6: One is (of) the same name and of those who are (of) the same name.
cnd18:32.1: "Brāhmaṇa! Be served by me": The Blessed One is trusted, served, respected by
cnd18:32.2: me, (who is) asking questions all the time.
cnd18:33.1: <em>105 : For example, as a bird will live in a fruity forest
cnd18:33.3: After I abandon all those of narrow views like this,
cnd18:33.4: I am like a goose which has reached the great lake.

cnd18:34.1: "For example, as after a bird abandons a small forest, it will live in a fruity
cnd18:34.2: forest": A bird (twice-born) is called a bird (winged). Why is a bird born twice
cnd18:34.3: called winged? "Born twice" is born twice: from mother's uterus and the egg
cnd18:34.4: shell, born twice for this reason, so twice-born are called winged. "Like after
cnd18:34.5: abandoning a small forest," like a bird, a small mountain forest with little
cnd18:34.6: fruit, food, and water, after abandoning, after going beyond, after passing,
cnd18:34.7: after leaving, you will get, find, and obtain other fruits, large forests and
cnd18:34.8: dense forests with lots of food and plenty of water, will build shelter in that
cnd18:35.1: "Like this, after I abandon those of narrow views, it is as a goose has reached
cnd18:35.2: the great lake": "Like this" is a metaphorical arrangement. "After abandoning
cnd18:35.3: those of narrow views," Bāvari Brāhmaṇa and other his teachers compared with the
cnd18:35.4: Buddha and Blessed One, those who are rare, insignificant, inferior, lesser,
cnd18:35.5: little-seen, lower, non-supreme, inferior; after abandoning, after leaving,
cnd18:35.6: surpassing, passing, and transcending, the best-seen one obtains, finds, and
cnd18:35.7: gets the Buddha, the Blessed One: the immeasurable seer, the top seer, the
cnd18:35.8: unequal, the unparalleled, the uncontrasted, incomparable, heaven in the sky,
cnd18:35.9: bull king among men, lion among men, elephant among men, virtuous man with
cnd18:35.10: strong endurance among men, holder of ten powers. For example, as the geese will
cnd18:35.11: get, find, and obtain the large man-made or the natural pool, or the unshakable
cnd18:35.12: and immeasurable water accumulation of the sea-lake; similarly, the Buddha and
cnd18:35.13: the Blessed One are the unshakable ones, those with infinite brilliance, those
cnd18:35.14: who have developed wisdom, ...have discerning eyes, ...are clever, have proven
cnd18:35.15: to be unobstructed, have reached the four fearless ones, have pure aspirations,
cnd18:35.16: are white-covered (pure), do not talk, claim to be like that, are not small, are
cnd18:35.17: great, are deep, cannot be measured, are difficult to penetrate, have vast
cnd18:35.18: treasures, are equal to the ocean, have six peaces, are incomparable, are vast,
cnd18:35.19: and those who cannot be measured; he is the speaker like that, the speaker of
cnd18:35.20: the Path, like Mount Meru among the mountains, like the gold-winged bird among
cnd18:35.21: the birds, like the lion among the beasts, like the river reaching the sea, he
cnd18:35.22: is the master, the winner, the top one, and the great rishi.
cnd18:36.1: <em>106 : Whatever they told me before, before Gotama's teaching:
cnd18:36.2: Like this that was once, like this and that will be;
cnd18:36.4: All that is an increase in theory.

cnd18:37.1: "What they told me before": "What," Bāvari Brāhmaṇa and his other teachers, they
cnd18:37.2: explain, teach..., their own views, likes, inclinations, opinions, intentions.
cnd18:38.1: "Before the teachings of Gotama": Before the teachings of Gotama, on the other
cnd18:38.2: side of the teachings of Gotama, before the commandments of Gotama, the Buddha's
cnd18:38.3: precepts, the precepts of the victors, the precepts of the Tathāgata, the first
cnd18:39.1: "Like this and that was, like this and that will be": Legend that it was like
cnd18:39.2: this, and that it will be like this.
cnd18:40.1: "It's all rumors": It's all rumors, hearsay, inheritance, the teachings of the
cnd18:40.2: scriptures, logical inferences, reasoning, thoughts about theories, opinions
cnd18:40.3: accepted after contemplation, and they tell that they are not personally proven
cnd18:40.4: by themselves, not the self-proven method.
cnd18:41.1: "That is all the increase in theory": It is all an increase in theory, an
cnd18:41.2: increase in seeking, ...thinking, ...desire, malicious seeking, persecution, the
cnd18:41.3: thinking about land, the thinking about death, the thinking related to sympathy
cnd18:41.4: with others, the thinking related to the benefit of respect and reputation, the
cnd18:41.5: thinking related to not being scorned.

cnd18:43.1: "The one who is alone, the one who disperses the darkness, and the one who is
cnd18:43.2: sitting down": "One who is alone," the Blessed One is alone having become a
cnd18:43.3: bhikkhu, with no partner for righteousness as alone, with thirst for
cnd18:43.4: righteousness as alone, and "always free from greed" as alone, "always free from
cnd18:43.5: delusion" as alone, "always free from depravity" as alone, "always no pollution"
cnd18:43.6: as alone, "crossing the road without a fork" as alone, and "has already realized
cnd18:44.1: How is the Blessed One alone having become a bhikkhu? When the Blessed One was
cnd18:44.2: young, the black-haired youth possessed the happiness of youth. At the beginning
cnd18:44.3: of life, even if the parents didn't want (this), tearful, crying, and sighing,
cnd18:44.4: he still abandons his relatives, cut off all obstacles in the home, and cut off
cnd18:44.5: the barrier of his children and wife, ...family, ...friend, ...storage
cnd18:44.6: (warehouse), shave his hair and put on robes, go out from his home, being a
cnd18:44.7: bhikkhu in a non-domestic life, into a state of no possessions, then walk alone,
cnd18:44.8: live, act, go on, guard, and survive.
cnd18:45.1: How is the Blessed One alone without a partner? When he was such a bhikkhu, he
cnd18:45.2: was alone in the woods, wild forests, and border dwellings (sitting places):
cnd18:45.3: quiet, away from the atmosphere, living alone, suitable for sitting alone; he
cnd18:45.4: would walk alone, stand alone, sit alone, lie alone, enter the village alone for
cnd18:45.5: alms, go forward alone, return alone, sit alone in a quiet place, perform alone,
cnd18:45.6: live, move, go on, guard, and survive alone.
cnd18:46.1: How is the Blessed One alone with the disruption of thirsting love? He is so
cnd18:46.2: alone and without a partner, when he lived in reluctance, zealous, and
cnd18:46.3: self-effort. Under the Bodhi tree by the Nerañjarā River, with diligence and
cnd18:46.4: effort, destroying the devil (Māra) accompanied by the army, the evil demon, and
cnd18:46.5: the relatives of the relaxed; afterwards, the netted, strong flowing, entangled
cnd18:46.6: thirsty loves, he abandoned, drove away, ended, and made to go to no-existence.
cnd18:47.1: "People who have thirsty love as their partner,
cnd18:47.3: Become such a state, other states,
cnd18:47.6: Craving is the origin of suffering,
cnd18:47.7: Departing from thirsty love, without taking,
cnd18:48.1: How can the Blessed One be alone being always away from greed? "To abandon the
cnd18:48.2: state of greed" as aloneness, "to abandon the state of anger", ...the state of
cnd18:48.3: delusion..., the state of of contamination....
cnd18:49.1: How is the Blessed One one who has passed the road without a fork as alone? The
cnd18:49.2: path without a fork is called the four mindfulnesses, the four righteousnesses,
cnd18:49.3: the four divine bases, the five senses, the five powers, the seven enlightenment
cnd18:49.4: factors, and the eight sacred paths.
cnd18:50.1: "The one who sees the death of life (rebirth), the compassionate one,
cnd18:50.2: Who knows the way without forks,
cnd18:50.3: Using this way, they crossed torrents in the past,
cnd18:50.4: Will cross (in the future), and are (crossing) in the present."
cnd18:51.1: How is the Blessed One's single enlightenment being alone? Enlightenment is
cnd18:51.2: called wisdom, root of wisdom, power of wisdom, enlightenment of choice,
cnd18:51.3: investigation, vipassanā, right view of the four realms. The Blessed One
cnd18:51.4: realized that "all actions are impermanent,"..(omitted). "every collection of
cnd18:51.5: dhammas is extinguished." Or, everything that should be felt, should be
cnd18:51.6: conscious, should be awakened, should be enlightened, should be realized, should
cnd18:51.7: be touched, should be testified, everything is conscious of that consciousness,
cnd18:52.1: "Dispelling the darkness," .... "Sitting down," The Blessed One is sitting at
cnd18:53.1: "When Muni was sitting on the hillside,

cnd18:55.1: "He is the shining person, the creator of the light": The shining person is the
cnd18:55.2: wise, supremely wise, enlightened, distinguished, and wise. "The luminous
cnd18:55.3: creator," Creator of light, illuminator, bringer of light.
cnd18:56.1: "Blessed One is the one who is broadly wise": Blessed One is the one who
cnd18:56.2: symbolizes the vastness, wisdom is the symbol, wisdom is the flag, wisdom is the

cnd18:56.5: more, the serious, the object of that, the inclination, the lean, the winner,
cnd18:57.1: "The flag is the sign of the chariot,
cnd18:57.2: The smoke is the sign of the fire,
cnd18:57.3: The king is the symbol of the country,
cnd18:57.4: And the husband is the symbol of the woman."
cnd18:58.1: In the same way, Blessed One is the symbol of the vastness (the broad wisdom),

cnd18:58.5: emphasize the other, take that as the object, work hard, lean toward the one who
cnd18:59.1: "Gotama is the vastly wise man": As the earth is called broad.... Therefore, the
cnd18:59.2: Buddha is an extremely intelligent person.

cnd18:61.1: "The one who teaches me the Dhamma": "The one," that is the one who is the
cnd18:61.2: world-honored person, the solo person, and the one without a teacher who has
cnd18:61.3: realized the truth in the Dhamma that has not been heard before, and reaches the
cnd18:61.4: state of all knowing there, one who is in a state of freedom in strength.
cnd18:61.5: "Teaching the Dhamma," "Dhamma," the beginning is good, the middle is good, and
cnd18:61.6: the end is good; the meaning is correct, the phrase is correct; only the perfect
cnd18:61.7: and pure Brāhmaṇa line: four mindfulnesses, four righteousness, four divine
cnd18:61.8: bases, five senses, five powers, seven enlightenment factors, eight holy paths,
cnd18:61.9: Nibbāna and the path leading to Nibbāna; he explained, taught, informed,
cnd18:62.1: "Directly visible, immediate": Directly visible, immediate, you are invited to
cnd18:62.2: meet, guided, and the wise should experience it for himself. Or, he practices
cnd18:62.3: the eight sacred paths, he realizes that way indiscriminately and immediately,
cnd18:62.4: and he finds and obtains results. "Immediate," such as when someone leaves
cnd18:62.5: wealth to someone when they die, they wait for that time; the Dhamma is indeed
cnd18:62.6: not this. Anyone who is practising the Eight Noble Paths in his life will
cnd18:62.7: realize that path indiscriminately and immediately. He finds and obtains the
cnd18:62.8: Fruit, not elsewhere (the next life), not in the other world (the next life),
cnd18:63.1: "Extinction of thirst, no disaster": "Thirst for love," the thirst for form....
cnd18:63.2: "Extinction of thirst," extinction of thirst, ...of greed, of hatred,
cnd18:63.3: ...delusion, interest, past rebirth, knot of rebirth, some, reincarnation,
cnd18:63.4: rotation. "No disaster," pollution and formation are called disasters, the
cnd18:63.5: renunciation of catastrophes, the cessation of catastrophes, the disruption of
cnd18:63.6: catastrophes, the discontinuation of catastrophes, non-living, and Nibbāna.

cnd18:64.4: where," no matter where, where, somewhere, inside or outside of oneself, or

cnd18:91.1: "Faith, joy, mind, thought": "Faith," everything about faith, belief, trust,
cnd18:91.2: extremely pure faith, root of faith, faith in the Blessed One. "Joy," everything
cnd18:91.3: about the joy of the Blessed One, happiness, rejoicing, laughter, satisfaction,
cnd18:91.4: and the enthusiasm of the heart. "Thought": everything about the heart,
cnd18:91.5: intention, heart, white (clean), intention, the mind, the root of the mind, the
cnd18:91.6: consciousness, the corresponding realm of consciousness. "Mind," all about the
cnd18:91.7: thoughts of the Blessed One, remembrance, and mindfulness.

cnd18:93.3: broad wise one, great wise one, the wise person, the quick wise person, the
cnd18:93.4: discerning wise person; the earth is called broad, and the Blessed One has the
cnd18:93.5: same expansive wisdom as that earth.

cnd18:94.2: Buddha's direction, the one who is directed to it, the one who strives, the one
cnd18:94.3: who leans toward the one who overcomes, the one who increases.

cnd18:97.1: "The body doesn't walk there": The body doesn't walk, go, walk forward, go to

cnd18:99.3: him": The mind is united with the Buddha, bound, bound completely.

cnd18:101.1: "Lying in the mud and trembling": "Lying in the mud," in the mud of desire, in
cnd18:101.2: the mire of desire, in the pollution of desire, in the hook of desire, in the
cnd18:101.3: heat of desire; lying, dwelling, living in the obstacles of desire. "Trembling,"
cnd18:101.4: trembling with throbs of thirst, ...with seeing..., pollution, effort,
cnd18:101.5: retribution, intentional deeds, greed, rage, idiotic foolishness; bound by
cnd18:101.6: sloth, clinging to views, taking what is seen, scattered (disorganized),
cnd18:101.7: doubtful failure, with tormenting potential trends of trouble; because of
cnd18:101.8: profit, no profit, fame, no fame, praise, rebuke, pleasure, suffering; life, old
cnd18:101.9: age, sickness, death, sorrow and despair, the suffering of hell, of the animal
cnd18:101.10: world, the hungry ghost world...; with the root of the suffering of entering the
cnd18:101.11: womb, ...living in the womb, ...birth, ...living..., of being at the mercy of
cnd18:101.12: others, of one's own actions, other people's actions; eye diseases, ear...,
cnd18:101.13: nose, tongue, body, head, external ear, mouth, tooth, lip, cough, breath,
cnd18:101.14: external nose disease, fever, old age, abdominal illness, coma, dysentery,
cnd18:101.15: abdominal pain, cholera, leprosy, tumor, ringworm, lung disease, epilepsy,
cnd18:101.16: scabies, rheumatism, scratching (skin disease), dry and cracked skin, blood gall
cnd18:101.17: bladder disease, diabetes, hemorrhoids, rashes, ulcers, diseases caused by
cnd18:101.18: gallbladder, phlegm, wind diseases, diseases of the three sets of diseases,
cnd18:101.19: diseases born of the seasons, of incorrect postures, diseases that strike
cnd18:101.20: suddenly, diseases born of the fruit of kamma, of cold, heat, hunger, thirst,
cnd18:101.21: dung, urine, the pain of contact with the fly mosquito, (wind,) the sun, and the
cnd18:101.22: snake; suffering of the dead mother, ...father, brothers, sisters, son,
cnd18:101.23: daughter, loss of relatives, loss of money, loss from disease, decay; throbbing,
cnd18:101.24: trembling all over, (strong) trembling, trembling greatly with the pain of
cnd18:102.1: "I floated from island to island": From master to master, from Dhamma to Dhamma,
cnd18:102.2: from group to group, from view to view, from way to way, from Path to Path, I
cnd18:103.1: "Then I saw the enlightened person": "Then," the continuation of the
cnd18:103.2: sentence.... "See," see, be able to reach, understand. "Enlightened One," that
cnd18:104.1: "Those who cross the flood, those who have no trouble": "The one who crosses the
cnd18:104.2: flood," The Blessed One is the one who crosses the torrent of desire,
cnd18:104.3: ...torrents of being, the torrents of seeing, and of ignorance, has passed,
cnd18:104.4: surpassed, transcended, traversed, crossed, and overcome all the cycles of
cnd18:104.5: rebirth. He is the one who has descended.... "The one who has no troubles" in
cnd18:104.6: four types of troubles: the troubles of desire, the troubles of being, the
cnd18:104.7: troubles of seeing, and the troubles of ignorance. Those troubles have been
cnd18:104.8: abandoned for the Buddha and the Blessed One, broken, the root has been cut off,
cnd18:104.9: ..., therefore, the Buddha is called the one who has no troubles.
cnd18:105.1: <em>117 : (The Blessed One:) As Vakkali has sent faith,

cnd18:105.4: Then you will go beyond the realm of death.

cnd18:105.15: You should also send forth faith, Piṅgiya!
cnd18:105.16: Then you will go beyond the realm of death.
cnd18:106.1: "Vakkali is the one who sends faith, as well as Bhadrāvudha and Ālạvi Gotama":
cnd18:106.2: Vakkali is a believer, a serious believer, a leader with faith, a believer who
cnd18:106.3: overcomes the solution, and a believer, those who have reached the state of
cnd18:106.4: Arahant, such as Bhadrāvudha, ...such as Ālạvi Gotama....
cnd18:107.1: "In the same way, you should also issue faith": The same, you should release,
cnd18:107.2: issue, fully issue, increase, send, and fix the faith: "All actions are
cnd18:107.3: impermanent," you should release...; "all deeds are suffering"...; "all dhammas
cnd18:107.4: are without self"...; "any collection of dhammas is the extinction of
cnd18:108.1: "Piṅgiya! You will go to the other side of the realm of the god of death": The
cnd18:108.2: realm of the god of death is called the pollution and the various aggregates and
cnd18:108.3: creations; the other side of the realm of the death is called non-living and
cnd18:108.4: Nibbāna, that is the cessation of all actions, the cessation of all attachments,
cnd18:108.5: the cessation of craving, greed, extinction, and Nibbāna. "Piṅgiya! You will go
cnd18:108.6: to the other side of the realm of death": You will go to the other side, you
cnd18:108.7: will reach the other side, you will prove the other side, you will testify to
cnd18:109.1: <em>118 : (Piṅgiya:) In this way I gain more confidence:
cnd18:109.3: The one who opened the covering, the enlightened person,
cnd18:109.4: The non-desolate person, and the eloquent person.
cnd18:109.5: <em>118 : (Piṅgiya:) In this way I gain more confidence:
cnd18:109.7: The one who opened the covering, the enlightened person,
cnd18:109.8: The non-desolate person, and the eloquent person.
cnd18:109.9: <em>118 : (Piṅgiya:) In this way I gain more confidence:
cnd18:109.11: The one who opened the covering, the enlightened person,
cnd18:109.12: The non-desolate person, and the eloquent person.
cnd18:109.13: <em>118 : (Piṅgiya:) In this way I gain more confidence:
cnd18:109.15: The one who opened the covering, the enlightened person,
cnd18:109.16: The non-desolate person, and the eloquent person.
cnd18:110.1: "In this way I gain more confidence": This way I gain more confidence, I am more
cnd18:110.2: confident, I am more trusting, I am more victorious: "All actions are
cnd18:110.3: impermanent," I am more confident...; "all actions are suffering"...; "all
cnd18:110.4: dhammas are selfless"...; "any collection is an extinction"....
cnd18:111.1: "After hearing the words of Muni": "Muni".... "After hearing Muni's words": Your
cnd18:111.2: speech, language, teaching, admonitions, after hearing, grasping, understanding,
cnd18:112.1: "The one who has opened the covering, the enlightened one": "The covering,"
cnd18:112.2: there are five types of covering: the covering of craving, the covering of
cnd18:112.3: seeing, the covering of pollution, the covering of evil deeds, the covering of
cnd18:112.4: ignorance; for the Buddha and the Blessed One, those coverings have been opened,
cnd18:112.5: been destroyed, unlocked, completely unlocked, cut off, severed, calmed down,
cnd18:112.6: halted, cannot arise, have been burned by the fire of wisdom, Therefore, the
cnd18:112.7: Buddha is the one who has opened the covering. "Enlightened One," ....
cnd18:113.1: "Those who are not desolate, those who have eloquence": The desolation of greed,
cnd18:113.2: the desolation of anger, the desolation of ignorance, the desolation of anger,
cnd18:113.3: the desolation of resentment.... For the Buddha and the Blessed One, they have
cnd18:113.4: been cut off.... Therefore, the Buddha is not desolate.
cnd18:114.1: "Those who have the ability of debate (eloquence)," there are three types of
cnd18:114.2: people who have the ability of debate: the ones who have learned, the ones who
cnd18:114.3: questioned and the ones who have proven. What is a learned debater? Here, a
cnd18:114.4: certain type of people are learners of the language of the Buddha (the teachings
cnd18:114.5: of the Buddha): Suttas, Geyya, Veyyākaraṇa, Gātha, Udāna, Itivuttaka, Jātaka,
cnd18:114.6: Abbhuta Dhamma, Vedalla, who rely on his learning, this is a learned debater.
cnd18:115.1: What is a debater who asks repeatedly (questions)? Here, a certain type of
cnd18:115.2: person is a questioner in (their own) interests, justice (righteous)
cnd18:115.3: (interests), characteristics, reasons, possibility and impossibility, and
cnd18:115.4: appears after reliance on that questioning. This is the debater of repeated
cnd18:116.1: What is a proven debater? Here, a certain type of person is the attainer of the
cnd18:116.2: four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four divine bases, the five
cnd18:116.3: senses, the five powers, the seven enlightenment factors, the eight holy ways,
cnd18:116.4: the four Samaṇa fruits, the four debates, and the six magic powers. Those who
cnd18:116.5: have known the reason, known the method, and known the word are the ones who
cnd18:116.6: defend in the known principle, defend the dhamma in the known dhamma, and the
cnd18:116.7: words in the known words. The three types of wisdom are not hindered.
cnd18:116.8: Understanding wisdom, the Blessed One ...possessing this argument will not
cnd18:116.9: hinder the understanding of wisdom. Therefore, the Buddha is a talented person.
cnd18:116.10: If he hasn't learned, questioned, and proved, what will he answer?
cnd18:117.1: <em>119 : After proving (directly knowing) the Supreme Heaven,
cnd18:117.5: <em>119 : After proving (directly knowing) the Supreme Heaven,
cnd18:117.9: <em>119 : After proving (directly knowing) the Supreme Heaven,
cnd18:117.13: <em>119 : After proving (directly knowing) the Supreme Heaven,
cnd18:118.1: "Knowing the Supreme Heaven": "Heaven," there are three types of heavens: there
cnd18:118.2: are three types of heaven: general (secular, worldly) heaven, rebirth heaven,
cnd18:118.3: and pure heaven. What is secular heaven? Kings and princes and queens are called
cnd18:118.4: secular heavens. What is the rebirth heaven? The four great god kings, the realm
cnd18:118.5: of the thirty-three gods, Tusita heaven, fashioned heaven, all Brahma heavens,
cnd18:118.6: and all the heavens above that are called rebirth heavens. What is pure heaven?
cnd18:118.7: The troubles of the disciples of the Tathāgata, Arahants, and Paccekabuddhas,
cnd18:118.8: have been exhausted, this is called pure heavens. The Blessed One is of the
cnd18:118.9: general heaven, the rebirth heaven, the pure heaven, and the victorious heaven,
cnd18:118.10: the heaven among the heaven, the lion among the lions, the dragon among the
cnd18:118.11: dragons, the lord among the lords, the Muni among the Munis, the king among the
cnd18:118.12: kings. After the Blessed One has realized the "Supreme Heaven" of the secular
cnd18:118.13: heaven, the Supreme Heaven of the rebirth heaven, the Supreme Heaven of the pure
cnd18:118.14: heaven, after understanding, after weighing, after judging, after separating,
cnd18:119.1: "He understands everything": The Blessed One understands, knows, touches, and
cnd18:119.2: penetrates the method that the Supreme Heaven should do for oneself and others.
cnd18:119.3: What is the method of one's own Supreme Heaven? Correct way, follow the way...,
cnd18:119.4: eight holy paths, these are called the methods of one's own supreme heaven.
cnd18:120.1: What is the method of others' Supreme Heaven? The correct way..., the eight holy
cnd18:120.2: paths, these are known as the ways of the Supreme Heaven of others. In this way,
cnd18:120.3: the Blessed One understands, knows, reaches, and penetrates the Supreme Heaven
cnd18:121.1: "The master is the ender of the problems (questions)": "The Blessed One is the
cnd18:121.2: ender (of the problems), the ultimate, the limit, the circle (conclusion), the
cnd18:121.3: end of the problem of form, the ultimate, ...of the heard question..., of the
cnd18:121.4: bhikkhu, of the bhikkhuni, of male lay devotees, of female lay devotees, the
cnd18:121.5: king's problem, the khattiya problem, ...Brāhmaṇa..., vessa, sudda, spirits,
cnd18:121.6: gods; the ultimate, the limiter, and the conclusion.
cnd18:122.1: "Master," The Blessed One is the leader, such as the leader of the caravan,
cnd18:122.2: making all living beings cross the danger zone: making them cross the danger
cnd18:122.3: zone of thieves, ...with beasts, ...of hunger, ...of no water, he makes it come
cnd18:122.4: out, makes it come over, makes it pass, and makes it reach the ultimate place of
cnd18:122.5: stability. In the same way, the Blessed One is the leader of the caravan and
cnd18:122.6: enables all living beings to pass through dangerous zone: make them pass through
cnd18:122.7: the danger zone of life, ...of age, disease, death, sadness, sorrow, suffering,
cnd18:122.8: worry, despair, greed, anger, foolishness, conceit, seeing, pollution, evil
cnd18:122.9: deeds; he crosses the dense forest of greed, the dense forest of anger, ...of
cnd18:122.10: foolishness, conceit, seeing, pollution, evil deeds;, he makes them come out,
cnd18:122.11: makes them through, makes them pass, makes them reach stability, non-living, and
cnd18:123.1: Or, the Blessed One is the guide, the moderator, the comforter, the informer,
cnd18:123.2: the one who makes it deliberate, the one who sees it, and the one who makes it
cnd18:123.3: clear. Or, the Blessed One is the founder of the unborn Path, the producer of
cnd18:123.4: the unborn Path, the unannounced preacher; the one who knows the Path, the
cnd18:123.5: knower of the Path, the acquaintance of the Path, and (his) disciples now live
cnd18:123.6: in the companionship of the Path, and will be the possessors in the future.
cnd18:124.1: "Acknowledgement of the doubter": When the doubter arrives, he becomes
cnd18:124.2: undoubtful; when the person with a mark arrives, he becomes the unmarked; when
cnd18:124.3: the person with doubts arrives, he becomes one with no doubts; with greed...,
cnd18:125.1: <em>120 : What cannot be moved, cannot be shaken,
cnd18:125.2: For which there is no metaphor, no matter where,
cnd18:125.3: Indeed I will go (to that; Nibbāna), there is no doubt for me here,
cnd18:125.4: So please remember me as one with a victorious mind.
cnd18:125.5: <em>120 : What cannot be moved, cannot be shaken,
cnd18:125.6: For which there is no metaphor, no matter where,
cnd18:125.7: Indeed I will go (to that; Nibbāna), there is no doubt for me here,
cnd18:125.8: So please remember me as one with a victorious mind.
cnd18:125.9: <em>120 : What cannot be moved, cannot be shaken,
cnd18:125.10: For which there is no metaphor, no matter where,
cnd18:125.11: Indeed I will go (to that; Nibbāna), there is no doubt for me here,
cnd18:125.12: So please remember me as one with a victorious mind.
cnd18:125.13: <em>120 : What cannot be moved, cannot be shaken,
cnd18:125.14: For which there is no metaphor, no matter where,
cnd18:125.15: Indeed I will go (to that; Nibbāna), there is no doubt for me here,
cnd18:125.16: So please remember me as one with a victorious mind.
cnd18:126.1: "That which cannot be moved, cannot be shaken": That which cannot be moved is
cnd18:126.2: called non-living, Nibbāna, that is the cessation of all actions.... "Can't be
cnd18:126.3: moved," Can't be greedy, angered, ignorant, resentful, concealing (evil),
cnd18:126.4: domineering, jealous, stingy, deceitful, cunning, stubborn, passionate,
cnd18:126.5: conceited, arrogant, relaxed, all pollution, all evil deeds, all scorching heat,
cnd18:126.6: all troubles, all torment, all irritation, all unwholesome deeds; Nibbāna is
cnd18:127.1: "The one that cannot be shaken," the one that cannot be shaken is called
cnd18:127.2: non-living, Nibbāna.... For Nibbāna, the arising is not known, it does not
cnd18:127.3: dissipate, its variation is not known, and Nibbāna is constant, firm, eternal,
cnd18:128.1: "For that, there is no metaphor no matter where it is": "For that," for Nibbāna.
cnd18:129.1: "Indeed I will go, and there is no doubt for me here": "Indeed," this is the
cnd18:129.2: decisive language, the undoubted language.... "I will go," I will go, I will
cnd18:129.3: arrive, I will reach, I will testify. "For me there is no doubt here," "Here,"
cnd18:129.4: there is no doubt, no hesitation, no doubt of Nibbāna, not existing, no being
cnd18:129.5: known, undiscovered, cut off, disconnected, calmed down, stopped, unable to
cnd18:129.6: arise, burned by the fire of wisdom.
cnd18:130.1: "In this way, please remember me as one who has a victorious mind": "Please
cnd18:130.2: remember me in this way," please so distinguish me. "The victorious mind," those
cnd18:130.3: who lean towards Nibbāna, those who include towards Nibbāna, those who overcome
cnd18:131.1: The other side path is completed.
